TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed RegistryHive extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the possible values for a top-level node on a foreign machine.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `RegistryHive` values are used by the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenRemoteBaseKey%2A> method to represent the top-level node of a requested key on a foreign (remote) machine. The node that can be opened with the OpenRemoteBaseKey method must be one of these top-level `RegistryKeys`. Further access to the subkeys of the identified node is available using using methods in <xref:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey>, so long as the the user has appropriate permission.
## Examples The following code example shows how to open a registry key on a remote computer and enumerate the values of the key. The remote computer must be running the remote registry service. Specify the name of the remote computer as a command-line argument when invoking the program.
[!code-cpp[Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenRemoteBaseKey#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-microsoft.win32.regist_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenRemoteBaseKey#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-microsoft.win32.regist_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenRemoteBaseKey#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-microsoft.win32.regist_1_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Win32.RegistryHive ClassesRoot = int32(-2147483648)

Docs.summary: Represents the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT base key on another computer. This value can be passed to the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.OpenRemoteBaseKey%2A> method, to open this node remotely.
